docs.lead_paragraph: After the fall of Speaker Jim Wright, an arm-twister who alienated many lawmakers, House Democrats looked for integrity, calm and conciliation. They turned to Thomas S. Foley and Richard A. Gephardt. The two leaders buried the poisons of the Wright era, but now they face a very different and bigger challenge: how to steer the biggest legislative package to come through the House since Lyndon B. Johnson's Great Society program in the 1960's.

headline.main: Clinton's Point Men Face Doubts About Their Edge
